[color=#FFFFFF][b]Trolling: A Reminder[/b][/color]
On March 22, [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] announced that he will be closing accounts if "troll topics" are being debated on Hack Forums within the [url=http://hackforums.net/forumdisplay.php?fid=128]Science, Religion, Philosophy, and Politics[/url] forum. This was shortly after the user [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1827647][color=#00AAFF][b]ClaudiusPtolemy[/b][/color][/url] had his posting permanently suspended for debating the shape of the Earth. No more debating on troll topics people! To read more about this simply make your way to this thread, [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5211194]here[/url].

[color=#FFFFFF][b]Importance of Trust Scan Expressed[/b][/color]
On March 22, [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] bumped a thread regarding the Trust Scan feature in an attempt to stress the importance of the feature and how it can be significantly used to check who you are about to deal with. The Test Code option ensures that the member you are about to deal with has access to their two-factor authentication. Heed [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient's[/b][/color][/url] warning and use the trust scan! You may view the thread by clicking, [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5180331]here[/url].

[align=left][size=x-small][color=white][b]*[/b][/color] - As of the Friday prior to release.[/size][/align]

[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/exp/283/NotableThreads.png[/img][/align]

 [b][color=white][u]Announcement Threads[/u][/color][/b]

 [color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5203857][b]Loving[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url]
 [color=#333333]---[/color]After a day of drinking, Omniscient has decided to express his feelings about Hack Forums. 

 [color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5204396][b]Beta: Feedback and Advice[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b][color=#FF66FF]Omniscient[/color][/b][/url]
 [color=#333333]---[/color]Omniscient has created a thread looking for Feedback and Advice on the current state of HackerCraft. 

 [b][color=white][u]Informational Threads[/u][/color][/b]

 [color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5114645][b]The PHP Section Bible | Information, Rules and Advices[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=695943][color=#FFFFFF][b]Sakuto[/b][/color][/url] 
[color=#333333]---[/color] The user Sakuto has summarized everything you need to know about the PHP Section into one post! Good job on the Sticky Man award! 

[b][color=white][u]Entertaining Threads[/u][/color][/b] 

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5208501][b]What ethnicity are you attracted to?[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2701151][color=#99FF00][b]Command Prompt™[/b][/color][/url]
 [color=#333333]---[/color]Command Prompt asks the community as to what ethnicity attracts them most. Well, what are you waiting for? Answer away!

 [b][color=white][u]Contests and Giveaways[/u][/color][/b] 

 [color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5209121][b][SQUAD] $500 AGC giveaway[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=3036938][color=#FFFFFF][b]Rick.[/b][/color][/url]
 [color=#333333]---[/color]The user Rick. is giving away $500 in Amazon Gift Card currency to one lucky individual in the name of Hack Forums newest group, Squad! Now that is what you call a generous fella!

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5207584][b][Enigma] Legalize It Award | No signature[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2455005][color=#FFFFFF][b]๖ۣۜDarkIllusion[/b][/color][/url]
 [color=#333333]---[/color]๖ۣۜDarkIllusion is giving out the Legalize It Award to one lucky individual in the name of Enigma! 

 [b][color=white][u]Member Feedback Threads[/u][/color][/b]

[color=#333333]---[/color]No feedback threads were made this week. Really letting me down guys! Give us some feedback to host under this section! 

 [b][color=white][u]Miscellaneous[/u][/color][/b] 

 [color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5209767][b]Help me get some data (Relates to Prestige) - Part 2[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1306528][color=#FFFFFF][b]xadamkx[/b][/color][/url]
 [color=#333333]---[/color]The user xadamkx is back at it again trying to solve the prestige formula!

[align=center][img]http://i.imgur.com/ogZdKby.png[/img][/align]

[align=center][color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview[/font][/size][/color] [color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1104007][color=#00BFFF]AXiS[/color][/url][/font][/size][spoiler=][align=left]

[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=#FFFFFF][b]Armada:[/b][/color][/url] Welcome to the Hack Forums News
Before we start are there any shout outs you would like to make?
[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1104007][b][color=#00BFFF]AXiS:[/color][/b][/url] Special shout out to Travis Bickle (and possibly Roytoy), but other than that everyone in the Skype group chats I'm in. And you for getting me the legalize it award :)

[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=#FFFFFF][b]Armada:[/b][/color][/url] Always interesting to know the shout outs :P
So, I suppose the obvious start here is what brought you to the community?  I see you have been a member for roughly 4.5 years, what was it back then that found your way to registration on Hack Forums?
[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1104007][b][color=#00BFFF]AXiS:[/color][/b][/url] I don't exactly remember to be completely honest with you, but if anything it's probably going to be the generic "I wanted to learn how to hack Facebook accounts" answer. I didn't start getting involved in the community much until like 2013 New Year's I think when I first bought something from the marketplace (an eBook teaching me to make eBooks and selling them for profit) and was basically scammed, although it DID make me my first online $. I used that to buy l33t and just started to lurk around the marketplace, not posting much, just trying to learn new stuff here and there.

[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=#FFFFFF][b]Armada:[/b][/color][/url] Well, you certainly seemed reluctant to post initially, from my searches your first opened thread was back in 2013 boasting about 100+ defacements.
So obviously you gained something in that year and a half of lurking.  Further to this you seemed to take a clear interest in web forensics and exploitation, can you elaborate a bit on that?
[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1104007][b][color=#00BFFF]AXiS:[/color][/b][/url] To be completely honest with you, I used to be quite the script kiddie to start with. I tried learning SQLi injections manually but I wasn't very interested to start off with, so I started just using programs to do it with me (Havij). Then I'd get annoyed because the dorks I used to find the vulnerable sites always brought up sites that had already been hacked so the admin panels had been removed and I could never find them.
I started talking to some patriotic (if that's the right word) hackers and saw the damage they were doing to other countries by hacking their websites and servers. By talking to them, I moved on to finding vulnerable Joomla sites using the com_users exploit. Shelling the sites, rooting the server, defacing them, etc. I think I was just more interested in the defacements to be completely honest, as you can see by my zone-h link here:
http://www.zone-h.org/archive/notifier=AxIs
Then I realized that I wasn't really getting anywhere with this. What was I gaining apart from a little laugh with my friends when they saw the defacement pages I was posting on government websites? Nothing. So I turned my attention to money making online, starting off by learning how to make a simple WordPress website and partnering it with AdSense. Was making a decent amount of money each month, but eventually got banned by Google and kept getting banned. If I could get the traffic to my websites now and considering I knew exactly how AdSense works now (I didn't know anything about them back then), I think it would be possible to start making money with them again. Getting the traffic is the hard part though, I wish I'd had put adverts on my Snapchat Bomber :(

[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=#FFFFFF][b]Armada:[/b][/color][/url] Well, I must admit, that is an interesting turn of events and situations to have taken place to change focus so drastically.  Before moving ahead however, I would ask.  What pointers or tips do you have those interested in getting started in the web penetration and exploitation sector?
[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1104007][b][color=#00BFFF]AXiS:[/color][/b][/url] Don't be a script kiddie :P
Learn to code, some advice I got quite recently actually, was that if you know how to code, you know where the website developers could have made potential mistakes leaving the websites vulnerable.
If you know where the vulnerabilities are, you can exploit them.
Also, don't underestimate the power you have in your hands when you find the vulnerability. One simple vulnerability can bring the whole website to it's knees, and I know this having seen it done on HF many times.
And do something useful other than defacing the sites. Root the servers, sell the shells, offer to patch the vulnerabilities, make some money etc. Defacing is pointless unless you're doing it strictly for the publicity.
Also don't look to learn just one method. Maybe start with the simple ones like SQLi, then move on to something like XSS, and THEN go forward into looking at exploits in Content Management Systems like Joomla and Wordpress.

[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=#FFFFFF][b]Armada:[/b][/color][/url] Well-rounded advice.  Start basic and progress upwards.  In regards to your change in focus towards monetization and income generation.  The question of why is fairly obvious I would figure, but I am more tempted to ask why choose this avenue instead of say a regular part/full time job instead?
Further to this, what is your take on the "For profit" structure the Hacking community has taken on?
Myself growing up, it was all about freedom of information and technology.  Somewhere along the lines that changed, do you this this was for the better or worse of the Hacker scene in whole?
[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1104007][b][color=#00BFFF]AXiS:[/color][/b][/url] When I was at school (16-18 years old), I had football (soccer) as my main priority other than school. School and football took up all of my time so I didn't have time to get a part time job, because most days I'd be returning home at around 8PM. I like the idea of making money sitting at a computer, or coming up with an autopilot method and just see money flowing into my account. Hopefully I reach that stage one day. This academic year I should have gone to university, but I figured I'd take a gap year (a year out) and I do have a part time job at a very, very respectable retail place in the UK, but as I'm not working a lot of hours due to me having to revise for a few exams at the end of the year, why not looking to make some extra money while sitting at my desk.
Also, I'm not the type of individual that can work a 9-5 job I don't think. The only reason I'm going to university is to have a job when I come out just so I can save up enough funds start my own business or something, because I'd prefer to work for myself. If that fails, I'll have my degree to fall back on. In fact even while at university I'm hoping to start up something small locally, maybe website development for local business or SEO for local businesses (still need to learn how to do this, anyone that's willing to teach me, hit me up ;) ) , and save up some funds through university that way. I don't come from a very wealthy background and a lot of my friends do. They spend all their money on drugs and alcohol and laugh at me when they see me save it / try and invest in into things. I like money, so I try my hardest to get it. Plus the fact it was never handed to me, the fact I have to work for it myself, will make me feel ever prouder if I achieve something / become a millionaire when I'm a bit older.
Hmm, that's a very good question, never thought about that actually. 
I guess the money aspect of it can be seen as motivation for hackers. The more money that's involved, the more effort hackers are going to put in to find vulnerabilities and exploits. If the admins are smart, they'll use this to their advantage, patching them so they can't be exploited in the future. Then admins from other websites with the same vulnerabilities can patch them up also before they get affected or exploited.
Long story short, I think it's a good thing. Maybe the ethics have changed, like you said, going from freedom of information to money, but maybe in the long run it might benefit the administrators of websites / programs etc. That's why the likes of Google and PayPal have bounties for vulnerabilites found.
I hope you understood what I mean by all of that, was quite hard coming up with an answer on the spot and trying to word it correctly.

[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=#FFFFFF][b]Armada:[/b][/color][/url] Everyone has a reason and a story.  Your reasoning is as good as any others, after all who does NOT like money?  And to that degree, I can only say is to consider the "C.R.E.A.M. Theory"  Cash Rules Everything Around Me  (Wu-tang reference, I'm old leave me alone).  I will admit, one thing that has stood out to me all these years on the site is peoples ability to turn what seems to be nothing into money.  What I truly see a lot in the community is New Entrepreneurs in the making.  Simply just trying to work it all out for themselves.  You seem to be in the similar stage.  All the best in the endeavor.  And don't forget good ole Armada when your on the top there ;o).
Aside from the monetization game, what other specialties do you possess and what is the fascination in them to continue your pursuit in learning them?

[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1104007][b][color=#00BFFF]AXiS:[/color][/b][/url] I see a lot of new entrepreneurs too, but I don't like it when I see members scamming / selling non working products on the forum. That's not what entrepreneurialism is about.
Thank you, appreciate that. :)
Don't worry, I won't forget you. ;)
There really isn't much else, man. Not technology wise anyway. I think on HF I just want to keep the community safe, hence my MM service, because it really pisses me off when I see people getting scammed, I just wouldn't ever have it in me to scam someone, I wasn't brought up that way. I don't find it right, morally.
Erm, outside HF. I'm pretty good at Football I guess. Also found out recently (by working at this job) that I'm a pretty good salesperson (face to face). I work in the technology department, TVs, computer, etc. and I realized that I'm decent at selling this like that to people.
I'm also a very quick learner, be it school studies, selling techniques, etc. I hope this will take me far in life, if I see something being done once, I can learn and mimic it instantly. 

[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=#FFFFFF][b]Armada:[/b][/color][/url] Well, I suppose it is time to touch on the matter I am sure everyone is wondering about.
You were RKed and banned for an accident, care to elaborate on the whole Instagrammy drama?
[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1104007][b][color=#00BFFF]AXiS:[/color][/b][/url] Was waiting for you to ask me that. :P
So after releasing the Instagrammy award, Omni released the stipulations and the requirements in order to get it. I posted a picture on my Instagram promoting HF, PM'd Omni, and I was one of the first to get the award. Bear in mind, he hadn't given any pre-warning that members who deleted the post and violated the rules would get RKO'd anyway.
I had been just on one of the Skype group chats talking to HF members when someone linked me a screenshot of my profile, showing that I was banned and showing that I had -3 rep.
Normally while on these Skype chats I'd be browsing HF at the same time, but this time I was indulged in the conversation so I didn't have HF open. 
I expected it to be a troll, besides, I've inspect element-ed plenty of profiles and screenshot them to just have a bit of fun with members in the chat, so I didn't think much of it at first. The members in the chat were laughing, at first I didn't think they were being serious, I don't think they even KNEW what had actually happened, they were just playing along with the troll.
Then I went on HF and refreshed the page only to get the notice that I'd been banned for two weeks. I thought no problem, must have been a mistake, the RKO was definitely inspect element, I'll just create a temporary account and post on the thread telling Omni he had made a mistake.
I made a temporary account and I saw that I had, in fact, been RKO'd. 
Naturally I was annoyed beyond belief. I had over 1100+ rep, all positives, it was flawless, trust me, it was hard to maintain that.
Having lost all of that, I lost my cool, started swearing and posting things on Omni's thread that maybe suggested my emotions had gotten the better of me (ps, I apologized to Omni for this and he said I had every right to be angry).
What annoyed me even more was the fact that people were telling me I had actually deleted the post, and suggesting that Omni doesn't make mistakes. Eventually I had been logged out of my temporary account, and my old account had been unbanned. I logged in, but again, none of my rep was there.
I received the joker award, and to be honest, the "reason" behind it did annoy me. I PM'd Omni asking wtf had been going on and why he'd do something like that without at least PM'ing me first, and he explained it had been a genuine mistake and that because I posted two pictures onto that Instagram account AFTER, he was skimming through it and didn't see the HF post, and gave me the green apple award too (he really doesn't want to give me the flamer award).
He apologized to me and I said that's all well and good but let's be honest, it doesn't bring back my rep*. He gave me confidence that this wouldn't ruin me and that I'd bounce back, and to be fair he was quite understanding that the fact I'd lost my cool. I did offer some constructive criticism, like maybe he shouldn't make decisions like that rashly, because obviously I wouldn't lose a 4 year old account and 1k rep for an award (I wondering if I'd get the award whore award for saying that I would..). I got a little bit of the rep back already, so I guess that's okay, and a lot of the members are saying it was worth losing all that rep for two awards, but to be honest with you... I'm not sure if it was worth it or not, yet.
*People may be wondering why I made / make such a big deal of my rep.
I was planning to release a few products later this week. Of course all of this drama would have brought a bit more publicity to me, but 1k rep would have helped greatly, no?
What new member would buy a product from you if you had no rep and no awards?
See where I'm coming from?
No matter how much we try to deter away from it, the fact is that's how newer members decide if you're trusted or not. Awards and rep.

[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=#FFFFFF][b]Armada:[/b][/color][/url] Well, that admittedly was an unusual and uncommon series of events.  It was cleared up eventually, and your rep is SLOWLY restoring back to normal.  If there is anything you can say about all of this, you got 2 great awards from the experience though. AND you managed to give Omni a good laugh, something I suspect he does not get a lot of when dealing with general "work" around here.
But All of this being said, I think it is about time to wrap this interview up.
Before we go, though, I’d like to ask if you have anything further you would wish to input or say openly to the community?
[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1104007][b][color=#00BFFF]AXiS:[/color][/b][/url] Yes, emphasis on "slowly".
Yeah, I guess he got a little laugh out of it. I wasn't laughing though. -_-
Yep, this will mainly be directed at the members using the marketplace. Please, do everything in your power to prevent being scammed. I hate seeing it happen. PM me on HF at any time because I'm online nearly 24/7 and use me as a MM, or even if you don't want to use me, there's plenty of MM like Regulus, Minimalist etc. Just make sure you don't get scammed please, I hate seeing that happen.
That's about it Armada, thanks for this, and also, good luck with your future plans :)

[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=#FFFFFF][b]Armada:[/b][/color][/url] Well, thank you for the time for the interview, it as always is greatly appreciated to get to know members a little more and create dialog through the community.  All the best wishes to you and your monetization efforts in the future as well.

[/align][/spoiler][/align]

[b][color=white]We are experimenting...[/color][/b]
Don't worry, you will be happy to know I haven't replaced iHydra. HFNT is experimenting with the publishing and posting of the HF News. Credits to the whole Writers group as they put the effort into writing the news weekly.

[b][color=white]Interesting fact...[/color][/b]
You more than likely didn't know that doing the graphics for the HF News is actually harder than compiling it all together. Kudos to iHydra for doing it week in and week out.

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][img]http://i.imgur.com/5dC2rwj.png[/img] [/align]

[align=left][b][url=http://techcrunch.com/2016/03/14/xbox-live-now-supports-cross-platform-multiplayer-with-ps4/]Microsoft Announces Cross Platform Play With Xbox and PS4[/url][/b]
After more than a decade of separate online play, Microsoft has finally announced the ability to play cross-platform this week. Following the steps of Rocket League and a number of PS4 titles, the Xbox One will not only be able to play with users of it's competitor, the Playstation 4, but also with PC users. Along with the ability to play cross-platform, Microsoft has also included a strange feature that will let you play with only users of the Xbox One, and not the PS4 or the PC. The first game to currently support the changes is Rocket League, but that is soon to change. Microsoft has not yet announced how in-game names will be displayed during cross-platform play.[b]
[url=http://www.theverge.com/2016/3/15/11213518/alphago-deepmind-go-match-5-result]
International Go Champ Lee Se-Dol Defeated by Google's AlphaGo AI[/url][/b]
In an interesting triumph of machine over man, the artificial intellegence program known as AlphaGo has defeated one of the world's best players of the Chinese board game Go at his own game - and pretty convincingly as well. In a 4-1 set in favor of the AI, AlphaGo adapted more and more, finishing the set out with a clear victory against 18-time Go world champion, Lee Se-Dol. The AI comes from a British company which Google owns that goes by the name DeepMind, and this AI is the first computer to ever beat a world class Go player. Se-Dol was competing against the AI to win a prize of $1 million, but since the AI won, Google has donated the money to charity. The win solidifies a giant step for artificial intelligence and machine learning as a whole, showing the true potential that can come from AI.

[b][url=http://www.extremetech.com/mobile/224709-the-gloves-are-off-fbi-argues-it-can-force-apple-to-turn-over-iphone-source-code]FBI Claims it can Make Apple hand over iPhone Source Code[/url][/b]
As the fight for privacy and security goes on, so does the case between the Government and Apple. Following the San Bernandino shooter case in which the Federal Bureau of Investigation wants tech giant Apple to unencrypt an iPhone and hand over its data, the FBI and Department of Justice have made a gargantuan statement, saying it can force Apple to hand over the goods with the 1789 All Writs Act, an act written over 200 years ago. As well as by citing this act, the Department of Justice also claims the case was an intentional marketing ploy by Apple, “This burden, which is not unreasonable, is the direct result of Apple’s deliberate marketing decision to engineer its products so that the government cannot search them, even with a warrant.” With similar companies falling to government demands, it seems that Apple is still fighting strong; at least for now. Whether Apple has to meet these demands may all be up to the court. [/align]

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/exp/283/GamingNews.png[/img][/align]

[url=http://gamerant.com/resident-evil-4-5-6-ps4-xbox-one/][b][color=white]Resident Evil 4, 5, 6 are Coming to PS4 and Xbox One[/color][/b][/url]
Japanese game developing company, Capcom, popularly known for their Devil May Cry, Street Fighter, Dead Rising, and Resident Evil series is pleased to announce that their Resident Evil 4, 5, and 6 games will be coming to the PlayStation 4 and Xbox One. Currently on the Xbox Live store, you can purchase the original Resident Evil, Resident Evil 0, and Resident Evil: REVELATIONS 2. In celebration of their 20 year mark in the game developing industry, Capcom states their Resident Evil 4, 5, 6 games will come to the new generation of consoles "before 2016 comes to a close". All three games will cost $20 each. With the re-mastery of the games, Capcom has not confirmed if there are any new visual improvements to the game. March 29, players on both new generation consoles will be able to purchase Resident Evil 6 will be available for PS4 and Xbox One beginning March 29th. Resident Evil 5 will be released sometime over the summer of 2016, following Resident Evil 4 in the upcoming fall. A trailer uploaded via the official Resident Evil YouTube channel can be seen [url=https://youtu.be/GsHC2tb7l64]here[/url].

[url=LINK_TO_SOURCE][b][color=white]First Pokemon Go Footage Revealed[/color][/b][/url]
Pokemon fans, this just in: footage for the new Pokemon Go mobile game has been revealed to the public by a beta tester. This highly trending topic is a must see for Pokemon fans. If you have not heard of Pokemon Go already, it will be a new mobile game, which will allow players to become a trainer once again and catch them all. "It's just another Pokemon game, how can it differ from all the others?" This new game is very unique, Pokemon Go will allow players to battle other Pokemon, catch and train other Pokemon, as well as discover a real virtual world around you! A cool new gadget will be released named the Pokemon Go Plus. With similar characteristics to a smartwatch, you'll be able to use this device around your wrist just like a watch, and be able to play on the go! When wearing the new Pokemon Go Plus device, players will be able to connect to their phones via Bluetooth! The cool device even interacts to your surroundings, flashing different LED colors when you are close to a Pokemon in your area. The game will be available for free in the App Store and includes in-game purchases. No set date has been posted, but those interested in beta testing the game will have a chance soon! Currently the beta is only available in Japan, but will soon be accessed in other regions soon! The leaked footage can be seen [url=https://youtu.be/eHgCmnVvfTI]here[/url].

[url=http://www.gameinformer.com/b/features/archive/2016/03/18/whats-new-in-gears-of-war-4s-gameplay.aspx][b][color=white]What's New In Gears Of War 4[/color][/b][/url]
The popular Third-Person Shooter series Gears of War, created by Epic Games and now managed by The Coalition, has recently released some new information regarding the latest game in the series, Gears of War 4. Just like the past games in the series, Gears of War 4 will only be available for Xbox One and Xbox 360. With new developers working on the game, a new story-line will be taking place with brand new characters, maps, and voice-overs. At the start of the story, you will be playing as the son of the well known main character in the previous Gears of War, Marcus Fenix. With the introduction of a new enemy, you will be trying to find your purpose in the world. As a young adult, you will be exploring the new world that the game has to offer, finding out who you truly are. For the month of April, the cover picture for the notorious gaming magazine, Game Informer, has revealed three of the new main characters you will get the chance of playing. The picture of the characters can be seen [url=http://i.imgur.com/5Ms8iXx.jpg]here[/url]! ([url=http://i.imgur.com/gMW7GHE.jpg]Delmont "Del" Walker[/url] left, [url=http://i.imgur.com/VlT0pYw.jpg]Kait Diaz[/url] center, [url=http://i.imgur.com/LPSQgeF.jpg]JD Fenix[/url] right) More information regarding the new characters can be read [url=http://goo.gl/oVS9gH]here[/url]. With the revival of the series after a long, long wait, players will be able to experience new melee animations, sick close-cover systems, and last but not least two-player co-op has made its return! There is no public date for the release, but it will be sometime around next fall.

[align=center][spoiler=Gears of War 4 Game Informer Coverage Trailer][yt]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DCDZWwzJblQ[/yt][/align][/spoiler]

[color=transparent]     [/color]

[align=center][img]http://i.imgur.com/vUruUpq.png[/img][/align]

[url=http://thehackernews.com/2016/03/hack-instagram-account.html][b][color=white]Instagram Used as Honeypot for Hackers[/color][/b][/url]
Within the last few days, an application has surfaced on Instagram claiming to be able to provide you with the perfect tool so you are able to see who has previously viewed your profile on Instagram. Applications who offer users this feature often have some sort of malicious code behind it which attempts to steal an account's credentials. Apple and Google are still yet to remove the two infamous apps named "InstaCare - Who cares with me?" and "Who Viewed Me on Instagram" which have a minimum of 100,00 downloads and 20,000 reviews. In order to steal an account's credentials, both applications require a person to log in with their Instagram credentials - little do they know, the developer of the application, Turker Bayram, is able to steal the entered credentials. Bayram also created another app prior to InstaCare dubbed "InstaAgent". It seems as if Apple and Google has been fooled not once, but twice. Two-factor authentication is advised on your Instagram.

[url=http://thehackernews.com/2016/03/how-to-unlock-iphone.html][b][color=white]FBI Wants Apple to Create "The Software Equivalent of Cancer"[/color][/b][/url]
Following the San Bernardino case, Tim Cook has boldly said that the FBI are wanting Apple to create the "software equivalent of cancer". On Sat. March 20, 2016, a third-party presented an alternative method to FBI. The FBI described the method as "feasible" and decided to submit a filing to cancel the upcoming court hearing. After cancelling the court hearing, the FBI now believe they have found an alternative method which will allow them to unlock the terrorist's phone without any assistance from Apple. The Department of Justice has suspended the hearing until at least next month. The Department of Justice have also refused to comment on who - or what - is helping the FBI currently.

[url=www.ehackingnews.com/2016/03/vmware-patches-xss-flaw-in-vrealize.html][b][color=white]Vmware Product, vRealize, Contained a XSS Flaw[/color][/b][/url]
VMware recently had to patch a XSS flaw in one of their products named vRealize, which recently became the centre of attention. The flaw was discovered by a researcher named Lukasz Plonka, along with a senior IT security consultant Alvaro Vidales. If exploited correctly, a hacker would have access to a user's work station. Needless to say, it would end in a disaster. Though VMware managed to patch this flaw without any user's data being compromised, it is now the third issue that VMware has had to deal with this year after failing to address a RCE (remote code execution) vulnerability in vCenter and a privilege escalation bug in the workstation.
